foods.name: Crack Noodles
foods.description: These garlic noodles are so incredibly quick, easy, and tasty, combining a few Western and Asian ingredients to make one very flavorful bowl of deliciousness.

flex.substitutes: Use any noodles you likey, thin or thick, round or flat. Yes, that includes Italian pasta too.
Use refined white sugar, brown sugar, palm sugar, or our favorite... Muscovado sugar!
Not necessary, but always a wonderful flavor enhancer.
Or why not fresh chopped up chili if you have it.
Most vinegars are fairly identical substitutes, e.g. white wine vinegar, apple cider vinegar, etc.

instructions: 1. Bring a pot or pan of water to a boil, then salt the water to your liking and add the noodles.
2. Slice the cloves of garlic.
3. Add butter to a wok or pan on medium high heat and fry for 1 minute.
4. Add soy, sugar, chili flakes, chopped spring onion, MSG, and vinegar. Set the heat to low until the noodles are done.
5. Add noodles to the sauce, set the heat to high and mix for 1 minute. Serve.
foods.notes: MSG is amazing in this dish.

foods.name: Okonomiyaki
foods.description: This might just be our favorite soup of all time. A one-pot dish, super quick to make, no frying, just a bit of boiling, and the flexibility of the dish is on par with fried rice! You could put pretty much anything into the soup, and you can also choose any BBQ sauce of your liking or make one yourself with just 4 ingredients. Also, it's freakishly delicious and addictive.

flex.substitutes: Use any noodles you likey, thin or thick, round or flat. Yes, that includes Italian pasta too.
Use refined white sugar, brown sugar, palm sugar, or our favorite... Muscovado sugar!
Not necessary, but always a wonderful flavor enhancer.

Most vinegars are fairly identical substitutes, e.g. white wine vinegar, apple cider vinegar, etc.

4. Add soy, sugar, chili flakes, chopped spring onion, MSG, and vinegar. Set the heat to low until the noodles are done.
5. Add noodles to the sauce, set the heat to high and mix for 1 minute. Serve.

foods.name: Ramen
foods.description: The fastest recipe in our collection to execute, this ramen is better than so many ramens we have had at restaurants and instead of taking 15 hours it takes a mere 15 minutes to make. Bring some water to a boil and let's do this.

flex.substitutes: Use any noodles you likey, thin or thick, round or flat. Yes, that includes Italian pasta too.
Use refined white sugar, brown sugar, palm sugar, or our favorite... Muscovado sugar!
Not necessary, but always a wonderful flavor enhancer.
Or why not fresh chopped up chili if you have it. We often add a hot sauce instead, or a chili paste like Tobanjjan.
Or if you want a mushroom-y ramen, go with mushroom bouillon.

instructions: 1. Bring a pot or pan of water to a boil, then salt the water to your liking and add the noodles.
2. Slice the cloves of garlic.
3. Add butter to a wok or pan on medium high heat and fry for 1 minute.
4. Add soy, sugar, chili flakes, chopped spring onion, MSG, and vinegar. Set the heat to low until the noodles are done.
5. Add noodles to the sauce, set the heat to high and mix for 1 minute. Serve.
foods.notes: MSG is amazing in this dish.

foods.name: Tortilla Soup
foods.description: A hearty and flavorful soup that originated in Mexico. A one-pot dish ready in just 15 minutesand we can add just about anything in it. The soup is usually made with pieces of fried corn tortillas, which add a crunchy texture to the soup. It also features canned beans, and we add all the aquafaba that comes with it. The soup is often garnished with toppings such as diced avocado, cilantro, red onion, and sour cream. It is a satisfying and filling meal that is perfect for a cold day.

flex.substitutes: The bell pepper, corn, jackfruit, cilantro, and toppings can be substituted with anything. You can add more vegetables, but also add fewer vegetables than what we listed.
Kidney beans, great white beans, black beans, anything goes!
Not necessary, but a flavor enhancer.
Or fresh chopped up chili if we have it. We often add a hot sauce instead, or a chili paste like Tobanjjan or tabasco.
This is added for crunch, so any chips fit. For example, we also love adding salt & vinegar chips, onion chips, BBQ chips, or if we don't have chips we may even go with roasted onion.
Use lime, lemon, or yuzu, or we can use any vinegar in half the amount if we don't have citrus.
We can use canned crushed tomatoes instead, or even chop up fresh tomatoes ourselves.

instructions: 1. we add all the ingredients except the toppings and lime to a pot and bring to a boil. The toppings are the avocado, red onion, and tortilla chips. Remember to add the aquafaba with the beans into the pot.
2. While bringing the pot to a boil, we chop up the toppings.
3. We boil on medium-high heat for about 5 min. We taste the soup during this time, and add more of any ingredient we wish.
4. When it has finished boiling we add the lime, and we also bring some extra lime to the table for us to squeeze in as we desire.
5. We serve the toppings in bowls on the table for each person to freely take.
foods.notes: This soup is slightly different each time we make it thanks to its versitility. Sometimes we also add plant-based melty cheese to it or plant-based sour cream with garlic.

foods.name: Silsi Pasta
foods.description: An umami-rich delight of Ethiopian origins. Silsi is an onion and tomato based sauce traditionally eaten with Ethiopian injera. The onions are plentiful and are cooked down until completely disintegrated, at which point we add berbere, a spice mixture where each family decides the proportions of each ingredient and takes to the mill to be ground.
